body.p: The Gault House was a hotel in Louisville, Kentucky. It was originally the home of Dr. W. C. Galt. During the Civil War, the hotel was the site of the assassination of US General William Nelson by US General J. C. Davis. The Galt House Hotel burned down on January 11, 1865.
